page.title: 07HETT VILLAGE 2
page.content:
From our survey we discovered that much of the village was built over a 100 years ago around the very large green.
The green is nearly half a km long and 100m wide with a{duck pond}at one end.Unfortunately the bad winter and ice meant a fox removed all the ducks in January and February.A lady told us she was really quite pleased because the ducks woke her up at 5.am every morning in the Summer.
At the other end of the green is a group of very modern Georgian style houses with an old tin Village Hall near them.
In winter the village is often cut off by heavy snowdrifts for a day or two. the drifts are cleared by the farmers
